section.summary:
Welcome to Engaging Adult Learners in Science! 

Purpose: This course provides an overview of the relevance and importance of science in the adult basic education/adult secondary education (ABE/ASE) classroom and introduces the use of scientific practices in the ABE/ASE classroom. 

Audience: This self-paced course is designed for adult education instructors, trainers, and coordinators.

Commitment: This course will take approximately 3 hours to complete. You must complete all units and assessments to earn a certificate.

Objectives: By the end of the course, you will be able to do the following:

  • Explain the relevance of science and science literacy to adult learners in basic education.
  • Identify scientific practices and relate them to everyday life scenarios.
  • Connect scientific practices to complementary teaching practices.
  • Integrate scientific practices into lesson design.

This course is composed of the following: 

  • Unit 1: Course Introduction
  • Content Units:
    • Unit 2: Understanding the Importance of Scientific Literacy for Adult Learners
    • Unit 3: Exploring the Scientific Practices 
    • Unit 4: Integrating the Scientific Practices in the Classroom
  • Unit 5: Course Conclusion

This is the main course page. Each content unit below features opportunities for review and reflection, including comprehension checks and a unit quiz. The final unit (Course Conclusion) includes a resource list with links to websites, videos, and other materials to enhance your learning experience. 

You will start each unit from this page, and you will return to this page between units.

To begin, select Unit 1: Course Introduction below.
